alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hurricane Local Statement issued September 16 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: This product covers NEW HAMPSHIRE AND WESTERN MAINE **Winds Gradually Diminish Tonight Behind Lee** NEW INFORMATION --------------- * CHANGES TO WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - The Tropical Storm Warning has been cancelled for Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal York, Kennebec, and Southern Somerset * CURRENT WATCHES AND WARNINGS: - A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Interior Waldo, Knox, Lincoln, and Sagadahoc * STORM INFORMATION: - About 210 miles east-northeast of Portland ME or about 250 miles east-northeast of Portsmouth NH - 44.5N 66.1W - Storm Intensity 70 mph - Movement North or 360 degrees at 16 mph SITUATION OVERVIEW ------------------ Post tropical Lee will continue to exit to the northeast tonight with gradually weakening winds. Gusty winds to near tropical storm force will continue for a couple more hours early this evening, mainly across coastal Maine before diminishing tonight. While the strongest winds are expected closer to the coastline, gusty winds will still be strong enough to lead to scattered power outages outside of the warning areas. POTENTIAL IMPACTS ----------------- * WIND: Potential impacts from the main wind event continue across the area. Remain well sheltered from hazardous wind having possible limited impacts. If realized, these impacts include: - Damage to porches, awnings, carports, sheds, and unanchored mobile homes. Unsecured lightweight objects blown about. - Many large tree limbs broken off. A few trees snapped or uprooted, leading to downed power lines. - Hazardous driving conditions on bridges and other elevated roadways. - Scattered power and communications outages likely. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS ---------------------------------- Continue to keep your cell phone well charged for as long as possible. If you lose power, use it more sparingly and mainly for personal emergencies and check-ins. Do not overload communications systems with idle chatter. Do not be a thrill seeker or risk your life for senseless photos or videos. Be wise and avoid becoming another statistic. NEXT UPDATE ----------- The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Gray ME around 8 PM EDT, or sooner if conditions warrant.
